headline: Best Ever Meat Loaf
description: This best ever meatloaf recipe lives up to its name. Cheese is baked into this easy meatloaf. Plus a perfect mix of ingredients to make a tasty crust.

video.description: A juicy meat loaf filled with vegetables and glazed with a sweet and tangy sauce.
video.name: Best Ever Meat Loaf

name: Best Ever Meat Loaf

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Whisk eggs, milk, salt, and ground black pepper in a large bowl. Add crumbled bread and stir until dissolved. Mix ground beef, onion, Cheddar cheese, and carrot into bread mixture; transfer mixture to a 9x5-inch loaf pan. Combine brown sugar, ketchup, and mustard in a small bowl; spread over the meat mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, 60 to 75 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: We made it and it was very good. Kids ate it. I omitted the cheese. I would Chop the onion fine next time. Also added a TBSP of garlic powder and two cloves of garlic minced. My wife is from Poland, and they have a version of this, but it has less onion. Fresh parsley and chopped paprika. Sometimes they the mixture is made into large patties and pan fried...
Did not have the carrots. Added 1/4 pound of cherizo. Excellent flavor.

I keep looking for the best meatloaf recipe. Following the directions exactly, this wasn't it. I couldn't tell what, if any difference the cheese made. The onions and carrots were still crunchy after cooking for 75 minutes (the meatloaf reached 165 degrees) and the onions were overpowering, taste-wise. On the plus side, it is a very moist meatloaf, and using soaked bread instead of bread crumbs gave it a nice texture, even with gluten-free bread.

I had to cut the recipe in half but it was very good. Adding cheddar cheese made a difference in taste. I dont like sweet so much so I left out the brown sugar. Just a bit of mustard mixed with ketchup. It took 25 min for half a meatloaf.

I've always put oatmeal in my meatloaf but I followed the recipe to a T (thought I didn't have any carrots on hand so left them out) and it turned out sensational. I used some sourdough bread I had on hand and it gave it such a great flavor. I highly recommend this great dish!

I really liked it, but the kids could not get over having carrots in their meatloaf. It often comes up at meal time especially when other guest are present. Can you believe momma puts carrots in meatloaf and they think its halairous.

The recipe was very close to my normal one. Except I use one pound each of lean ground beef and breakfast sausage. Opted not to put cheese in it. Always is a favorite at the table with everyone! Im a farm boy and use farm raised beef and pork.
Iâ€™ve made meatloaf for my family many times and they never liked it - until now. This recipe is a keeper. Very moist and leftovers are delicious!
The best meatloaf I've ever eaten! I added a bit of a South Texas spin the second time and it was just drool worthy.
I also cooked it in cast iron (that's all I had!) It turned out great. Best meatloaf I've ever made or eaten!

I have made meatloaf in the past but wanted to try something new so I tried this recipe for my b.f and me and he can't get enough of this one. It was moist, held together unlike mine lol and we will be making it again real soon. Thank you for the recipe
I liked it but I think I'd like it more with a little less salt.
It was very good. Used 12 grain bread and cottage cheese not cheddar also cooked it in cast iron in the oven for a extra crust factor.

This meatloaf has been in my recipe files for many years. I had forgotten about it for some time but when I noticed ground beef at a good price today I thought of it right away. Instead of baking in a loaf pan, I divided the mixture in two and formed free form oval shaped meatloaves on a foil lined sheet pan. I put a lengthwise dent in the middle of each one to hold any extra topping that I didn't spread on other parts of the surface. Turned out great. I like this method as it provides a lot of surface area for the topping and for browning. Great with garlic mashed potatoes and steamed vegetables.
This was so easy to make and the taste was simply delicious !! I used two pounds beef and it came out great.

It was very moist and flavorful. We did not want the cheese in it, however. Also, too much mustard in the topping for our liking. If you like mustard, itâ€™s great; otherwise, only put a very small amount in it. Like they say, you can always add to it, but you cannot take it out!!
I've made this recipe several times without changing a single thing! This recipe changed my opinion about meatloaf after making it for the very first time. The meat comes out so moist every time!

I make this meatloaf (but a keto version) quite a bit and my trained chef husband really likes it. I double the recipe and will use 1.3 lbs of beef and 1 lb of ground pork. Instead of bread, I use pork rind crumbs to make it more keto friendly, My husband really hates chunks of onions, so I sub with shallot salt and onion powder. The topping is probably the main reason he loves the meatloaf. I used no sugar added ketchup and swerve brown sugar. The meatloaf is moist and full of flavor and has a nice sweet glaze on top. I double the glaze recipe so that he can add more to his slice after cooking.
i loved it. it was so moist and easy to make
The only meatloaf we make since finding this recipe a few years ago. Perfect every time.

I made this because my family wanted meatloaf. I grew up with meatloaf on the table often and always hated it. I am so glad I found this recipe because everyone absolutely loved it. Even me. It will be a common meal in our house. Canâ€™t believe Iâ€™d ever say that!

A truly delicious meatloaf. It was great the first night and we enjoyed yummy sandwiches out of the leftovers. Like Matt says, "Try it and you will see". ***Update - I have made this meatloaf numerous times, always delicious! I've used ground turkey vs. ground beef which was equally delicious. It's also good if you add finely diced bell pepper. This has become my go-to recipe when I'm making meatloaf.

I liked how easy it was to make. I substituted dynasty gluten-free bread crumbs for 3 pieces of bread. I put onion powder and garlic powder in the meatloaf instead of an onion. I didnâ€™t put carrots in this time, next time I will try it. Then I doubled the mustard. My family loved it. Thank you for the recipe!!!!!
Simple ingredients that combine to make a delicious dinner

With some of my own revisions: turkey and chuck, onions and celery, piccapepper sauce, ketsup, 2 cheeses: CHeddar and Moz, All seasonings and two scrambled eggs, with italian bread crumbs, and olive oil.
No changes, and it was perfect!
Outstanding, made it just as the recipe directed. I did add a little hot sauce to the Ketchup for a little kick
Family loved this meatloaf. I added a habanero pepper. I will definitely use this recipe going forward.
No carrots - added bell pepper & topped with onion & bell pepper strips
I really liked this recipe. I think next time I will use a little less salt though. My husband even liked it and he has never liked meatloaf.
Excellent! Used half white cheddar cheese and half Mexican combination I use for tacos. I also used beef, pork and veal. Very moist.
very good
Genuinely the best meatloaf I've had
I made this with ground Turkey instead of beef. Also substituted pea milk for dairy milk. Turned out great!
Good recipe. Simple and delicious! I couldn't resist having some before taking the picture.

I never liked meatloaf, but my husband insisted he loves it so I went on a quest to find the best one. This one is not dry or bland like normal meatloafs. Very flavorful comes out delicious every time. My only recommendation would be to buy the less fat ground beef. Made it at my moms with the cheap stuff and the grease washed away the topping. My picky kids love it too.
Have not made this one yet but basically it's the same recipe I always make. Only difference I use ground turkey and pure maple syrup instead of the brown sugar. Mine always turn out great!

This was pretty Good. However I felt that the liquid ingredients were a bit much. Even though I used Dry Bread crumbled,let it sit for a while in the milk/egg it still didn't absorb all the milk. And the loaf seemed mushy and milky drippings oozed out. I will decrease the milk next time.
Way too sweet. Almost inedible. Yuk!
Turned out great. First recipe I made from the site in a while.
This recipe is fantastic just the way itâ€™s written. My new go to for sure!
I made this exactly by the recipe. It was the best meatloaf I have ever tasted.
It was very tasty and easy to make however it wasn't very firm. I will definitely try making it again but I think I will omit the milk.
I doubled the recipe and it was great.

I am 70 years old and have been cooking since I was 9. My mom started teaching me how to cook. I have cooked several meat loafs over the years. But this one, I have to admit, is the best one I have ever made. I did substitute Progresso Bread Crumbs Plain for the bread crumbs the recipe called for. I give this recipe a big 5 star.
This is really good, moist and so much flavor!

I've been making this recipe ever since I found it a few years ago. My husband LOVES it as do I. Only thing I do is add sliced provolone cheese in the middle of the loaf. Otherwise, this recipe is darn near Perfecto!

I halved the recipe and followed the recipe with no changes. For the two of us, there were no leftovers! As a bonus, I found the topping to be very tasty. I had previously used just a tomato base, but the combination of mustard with the ketchup made it pop.
Cooked it just like the recipe said except I didn't add any carrots.
I left out the carrots and cheese and it was the best meat loaf I've made so far.
Substituted bread for 1/2 cup of butter/garlic croutons and added BBQ sauce to the ketchup portion. It was delicious, tender and juicy.
My super picky BF said it was perfect. I don't like meatloaf myself but this wasn't to bad & the glaze was yummy.
Really good
Absolutely delicious! make as written except I grated the carrots to hide from my daughter.
Great recipe and comes out sweet as if it had fruit in it. I used only 1 lb. of meat and worked out fine. SautÃ© the onions first.

I did not use carrots or cheese. I substituted tomato paste for ketchup and used 1/2 onion instead of a whole one. I chopped a handful of baby Portobello mushrooms and added to the mix and forgot the dry mustard. I just mixed it all together and baked 1 1/2 hours. Best meatloaf ever!

Great meatloaf! I thought I may have ruined it because in my haste to make it I mixed in the brown sugar, ketchup and mustard by accident instead of making a glaze. But it still came out great! I also used BBQ sauce instead of ketchup.
Delicious. Used cracker crumbs instead of bread crumbs and 1 egg instead of 2. This will be my go to meat loaf recipe. Thanks.
The best ever meatloaf recipe! My whole family loves it!!!
We HATED the topping . We ended up scrapping it off because it beyond too sweet. Everything else was fine and yet I will never make it again.

My family LOVED this meat Loaf! The only change I made was using Taco Shredded Cheddar because that was what I had in the house. I would maybe use Ground Round or higher next time to cut down on the grease.

I made this meatloaf true to the recipe. It was fabulous. My kids never had meatloaf and now they have an appreciation for it. The glazing sauce on top gave it great flavor. Thank you Matt for sharing this recipe. It was a real big hit.
Best meatloaf Iâ€™ve ever had. Youâ€™re not gonna wanna lose this recipe!

Stumbled upon this recipe when wanting to use up some of my carrots. However, I wanted to also stay true to some of my own version so I used 1 cup of Panko bread crumbs in place of bread slices, placed slices of mozzarella cheese, in lieu of cheddar on flattened meat mixture and sealed cheese by forming into a loaf. I always lay 1/2 slices of uncooked bacon across the top. This is my new and favorite meatloaf.
yum yum yum!
I cut the recipe in half, cover the bottom portion with 1/4cp. bread creams add mixed beef cover with 1/3cp. cheddar chesse

It was just okay for me. I used one pound of ground beef and that was the only change I made. It was good and moist. I didnâ€™t really like the glaze. I will make it again but I will add a little celery and a little bell pepper and more spices. I will also top it with a glaze more to my liking (definitely without sugar). Itâ€™s a pretty good recipe once itâ€™s personalized to your liking :)
Great recipe, have made it several times, love it ( I do leave out carrots tho)
MY now go to meatloaf recipe Thank You

I've never been a huge fan of meatloaf... much-preferring burgers or other things I could do with the ground beef. But even I have to admit this was pretty good! I'll do it again to add a little variety. It went well with the mashed red potatoes recipe I found on here.
This is an excellent recipe! The only change that I made was to use garlic bread and then add more garlic. Delicious and easy!
Very easy to follow. Results are amazing.
The glaze was great, but the flavor of the loaf itself was a bit bland.
Very simple and delicious meatloaf recipe, just added some Italian parsley on top for looks. This one is a keeper!

This is the best meat loaf I have ever made! This is due in no small measure, to the delicious glaze! The only change I made was to use half lean ground beef, and half ground bison. The bison gives a richer, heartier flavor to all ground meat dishes. It is really good for leftover cold meat sandwiches.

THIS IS THE BEST MEATLOAF EVER!!!
So easy too!
This is THE BEST meatloaf I've ever had in my life! Family loved it!!
kids loved it as much as I did, hard to beat that.
I added ground pork and used a special meatloaf pan which separated fat from the meatloaf while cooking. The meatloaf is very juicy but not greasy and we enjoyed the ketchup glaze!
My daughters made this meatloaf. It was a little crumbly but that could have been the ground beef, the vegetables, etc. This is a really delicious recipe.
Added parsley and next time I will add garlic.

I was short 1/2 lb, so I added a couple of sausages out of the casing. Added some leftover red pepper and cubed some broccoli stems. The bread, I used onion sourdough, turns to mush and blends in nicely wit the neat and there ingredients. Turned out great. I might dial the brown sugar back just a bit. Overall, very good!
The onion didnâ€™t cook and there was way too much liquid so the loaf took forever to cook (and made a mess of my oven). The flavour was okay but I wonâ€™t be making this again.
This truly is the tastiest meatloaf I've ever made. My whole family didn't even know they were eating carrots. I made this as is with a little beef bullion absolutely scrumptious.
It was really good! My 10 year old actually liked it. Very moist.
This was a hit! Hubby and kids loved it!!

It was very good. I checked it after 45 minutes and it was already done. Took it out of the oven and covered it for 10 minutes while I mashed the potatoes. I used a whole chopped onion and it was good because we love onion, but you could use less. I used Dijon mustard instead of yellow because that was all I had and it was delicious. Will save to my favourites.
I liked it and especially the top.

Best meat loaf recipe ever and done with venison. I made it before exactly except bread crumbs instead of bread. My tweeks that I do now.... 2 pounds venision, no fat added. I add a mix of cheddar and mozarella, I cook the chopped onions in skillet before adding to the meat loaf. We use 1 cup bread crumbs instead of the bread. Perfect!!!

This was delish! I had a pound each of ground turkey and ground beef. I used those to make twoand adjusted the Ingredients accordingly. I did add a bit of worcestershire. The topping was fine. I prefer savory over sweet so I did not double that.

The list of ingredients look like pretty standard meatloaf faire but DANG this is a tasty meatloaf. Not sure why or how but it is a magical meatloaf combination! It is now my GOTO recipe for meatloaf!
Very easy to prepare. I left out the carrots, because hubby didn't want it, but I added garlic powder instead. Meat loaf was very most and tasty. I'll be making this one again!
Very Good! Everyone liked it.
I made these into burgers with lettuce & tomato and cheese Yummy
I liked the idea of adding cheese. It really gives off another taste, for those who prefer a cheeseburger opposed to hamburger. I also added Worcestershire as I have longed used this in my meatloaf.
Awesome as written. Adjusted to 8 servings and used 2lb of ground meat. Turned out great.
Adjusted for 4 servings and made exactly as written. I made two loaves and cooked them on a roasting pan so the fat would drain. The two loaves were done in less than 45 minutes. Perfect!
my family loves it
I love meatloaf and my husband does not. I cooked this recipe and he loved it! This is a definite keeper at my house.
